NewWords.Sentence: e.g. What is the Municipal Authority's attitude to/towards the proposal of a tunnel across the river?

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. probable 可能的  ad. probably 可能
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The train is likely to be late. (or：It's likely that the train will be late.)

NewWords.WordPhrase: a.  having a special advantage 有特权的  privilege n.  特权
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We are privileged tonight to have Chairman of the Committee of Foreign Affairs as our distinguished guest.
e.g. We're in the minority, more people are against us than with us.
e.g. There was no television on the island, but we soon learned to do without.
e.g. Mr. Singh was a highly successful salesman.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. full of danger; full of the possibility of failure, loss, etc. 危险的;有风险的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Investing in airlines is a very risky business.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. very unpleasant 令人难受的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The medicine has a nasty smell and an even nastier taste.
e.g. There is a brutish tribe in Amazon.

NewWords.WordPhrase: ad. (used to change the subject of a conversation or to support an idea or argument) anyhow 不管怎么说
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I shall go and see him anyway.
e.g. Any efforts to try to put the clock back will come to no good end.

NewWords.WordPhrase: stop providing (sth.); remove (sth.) by cutting 切断，中断；切下，剪下
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The telephone operator cut us off.
e.g. He was in competition with 10 others for the job.
e.g. Some educators are hoping to bring about major changes in the educational system.
e.g. Science and technology is the uppermost productivity.
e.g. I don't like skating; moreover, the ice is too thin.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a.  showing an interest in knowing about things 好问的, 爱探索的  inquire v. 询问
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. John is a boy with an inquiring mind.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a.  worldwide, of the whole earth 世界的, 全球的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Michael always dreams of taking a nonstop global flight.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. keep from appearing 抑制;压制
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Don't suppress your feelings when you are in love.
e.g. He helped me on his own initiative.
e.g. Serendipity （意外发现新奇事物的本领）has something to do with inventiveness.
e.g. It seems likely that the economy will slow down over the next twelve months.
e.g. The world's forests are disappearing at an even faster rate than experts had thought.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. make sure 保证，确保
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We can ensure that the work shall be done in the right way.
e.g. Education is the basis of a democratic society.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. 有知识的，了解情况的;明智的  inform vt. 告诉,通知
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Science is now enabling us to make more informed choices about how we use common drugs.
e.g. He is an expert in cookery.
e.g. He is not here at the moment.
e.g. I think she's in two minds about whether to accept his present or not.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a.constant; firm 平稳的；稳定的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. There has been a steady improvement in her condition.
e.g. It's evident that someone has been here.
e.g. Many adults enjoy cartoons more than children do.
e.g. Words are the elements of a sentence.
e.g. One of my classmates went to Utah to study astronomy.
e.g. A large audience crowded the concert hall.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  连续；系列；系列节目
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He saw a series of white arrows painted on the road.
e.g. He is a writer of historical fiction.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. control and make use of 驾驭; 利用
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Some scientists are working hard at how tide can be harnessed to produce electricity.
e.g. This is a photo of Mary with our house in the background.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a., n. 酸(性的);酸味的(物质)
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Acid ionizes（电离）in solution to give the positive ion（离子）of the solvent.
e.g. Temperature and humidity（湿度）can be controlled in greenhouse for the cultivation or protection of plants.
e.g. A nuclear family is a family unit that consists of father, mother, and children.
e.g. Weapon is an instrument of attack or defense in combat.
e.g. Genetic variance（变异）leads to the difference of individuals.
e.g. He is studying engineering at college.
e.g. What is the basis of your opinion?

NewWords.WordPhrase: exist or be found in 在于
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The cure for the problem lies in education.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  死记硬背  learn by rote 死记硬背地学习
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He learned the poem by rote.
e.g. The business has no relevance to the matter at hand.

NewWords.WordPhrase: 从…方面（或角度）来说；按照，根据
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The figures are expressed in terms of a percentage.
e.g. x + 2y = 7 is an equation.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. short; quick 简洁的;短暂的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. To be brief (with you), we can't accept such harsh terms.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a.  exact 准确的，精确的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Is this watch accurate?
e.g. He's some kind of mathematical genius.
e.g. The new assembly line has halved the production cost.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vi. be likely to happen or have a particular characteristic or effect 倾向，趋向
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. People under stress tend to express their full range of potential.

NewWords.WordPhrase: having the shape of; existing in a particular form 呈…的形状；以…形式
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The trees were laid out in the form of the figure eight.
e.g. a precise measurement / a precise instrument
e.g. We need a qualitative analysis.
e.g. Victory in the election was within her grasp.
e.g. I understand some of the concepts of the theory but I'm not sure about its details.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. as much as is needed, enough 充分的,足够的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Have you had sufficient sleep?

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt.  make (ideas, feelings, etc.) known to another 传达；表达
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I will convey the information to him.
e.g. Draw a diagram showing how the machine works.
e.g. This bridge over the river has a steel framework.
e.g. molecular weight / a molecular structure
e.g. The biology of bacteria can be quite hard to understand.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 晶体管；晶体管收音机
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. a transistor radio

NewWords.WordPhrase: cause to be understood 解释清楚，使被理解
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I'm not putting my meaning across very well.
e.g. A large proportion of the students were sick last week.
e.g. This is a truly beautiful picture.
e.g. The man used magic to produce six rabbits from his hat.

NewWords.WordPhrase: be part of a situation, system, etc.; be part of a group of people or things 适合；符合；属于
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The new college courses fit into a national education plan.
e.g. A father has many responsibilities.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. teach or train 教育
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The writer was educated at a very good school.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. give pleasure to; have as a guest 给...以欢乐；招待
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He often entertains friends at dinner in holiday.

NewWords.WordPhrase: ad.  as a result，therefore; from this time 因此;从此
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. It is very late; hence you must go to bed.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt.  get in touch with 与...接触
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Friendly contacts between different peoples（民族）facilitate the cultural and economic interchange.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. foreign; strange 外国的；陌生的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. a resident alien（外侨）/ an alien culture
e.g. It is generally accepted that the Chinese civilization is one of the oldest in the world.
